comments.body: Should not `include_tasks` be used directly and `run-test.yml` removed ? By default shippable logs mentions name of included file: `included: /root/.ansible/test/tmp/docker-registry-XXX-ÅÑŚÌβŁÈ/test/integration/targets/docker-registry/tasks/tests/<included filename>.yml for testhost`.

The reason for the double include is that these import lines are at the correct positions. If you include some files in a loop, the `included: ...` lines will all follow the include task. With the double include, there will be a proper include line before the first included test task. That makes it easier to quickly find the correct file where something failed.
Ok. Note that path of tasks are displayed (thanks to the default callback plugin) when log level is at least 2 (when an error occurs, test is retried with all logs enabled).

That's true, but I find it very useful when running it locally. I don't want to re-run it every time it fails with more verbosity, it takes too long for that :) Also, I've use the same pattern in a lot of other tests, and if I start removing it, I'd prefer to remove it in all places at once.
